text: <@U0KN2SSKE> <@U0ULK2JPP>, I also added my comments to FAB-1783 and FAB-1788
some months ago, there was a proposal that we should have a monthly news mail
do we have this? maybe, I missed it
and please: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3635/>
<@U1AU8DRQR>  - you mean a monthly update on Fabric specifically?   I know we have the mailing lists, but those are mostly questions.  I like the idea of a monthly "update" on fabric
yeah on Fabric :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U1AU8DRQR> that was discussed at tsc meeting 2 weeks ago for all projects to send monthly update
<@U0ULK2JPP> <@U0XQ35CDD> <@U0KN2SSKE> <@U0XPR4NP4> <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4715/>
<@U1AU8DRQR>: every month there is an update for each project... nothing detailed, goes in the Hyperledger newsletter.
I've kept them pretty general unless there is a major development/milestone
I think that’s a very good idea (to formalize these updates)
Especially as so much is going on and many things (at least in fabric) are beginning to converge.
<@U0KM61BCP> yeah I know there was a discussion about it, but I don't know where those newsletters are, please tell me where I can find them
<@U0P2GSA8Z>
<@U0P2GSA8Z|arnaud> has joined the channel
ask <@U0J038AJK> he might know
<@U1AU8DRQR>: <https://wiki.hyperledger.org/groups/tsc/technical-steering-committee>
FYI this morning's notes (via <@U184J2R7S>): <https://wiki.hyperledger.org/community/fabric-notes>
Can someone take a quick look at this please: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4649/>
<@U0KM61BCP>, <@U0KPFAZNF>, <@U0PB67X4K>, … : I want to merge this quickly.
on a plane about to take off
hi all
where is this newsletter?
jonathan you pointed to the TSC minutes
I really think we ought to do a better job than we currently do
and that's something I'd be happy to help with
unfortunately I don't know what the status is either
every time I'm dragged into something else for a few days I completely lose track of what's going on and it's really hard to get back into the swing of things
<@U0P2GSA8Z>: Yes, I pointed to the TSC minutes where it was discussed. I think we should have a nicely written up summary/monthly update or so that highlights the key points
ok
Can be posted to the wiki and probably also via email.
Does not have to be an exhaustive (or shall I say *exhausting* ;-)) list, but mainly highlights for people that want to get the big picture/status.
but so, you don't know where that newsletter is either, do you?
lol
I agree, but there should be enough to get an idea of where things are
I know most of the main devs and I'm not too shy so I will bug people to find out what's going on
but this is clearly a barrier that will turn many people off
Binh published a roadmap for 1.0 but who knows where we are at on that roadmap today?
I sure don't know although I'd like to because I get asked
Yes, I get the same questions probably (more or less)
Especially in between hackfests.
yes
Currently, people have to be “subscribed” to receive this.
See for example, the last one: <https://lists.hyperledger.org/pipermail/hyperledger-tsc/2017-January/000558.html>
We should probably format these better too.
we should have a web page somewhere that says where we are at, what's going on
who to contact
that we make an effort to keep up-to-date
Definitely. Probably areas/sections...
Also, now that you are saying it, probably with direct links to the specific Slack channels of each.
We see so many questions in the <#C0J02NU1E|general> channel, that some of us many times miss.
suggest looking at the fabric-dev channel
for some discussion that has happened earlier today
(lots of notes,etc,.)
ok, will do, thanks for the heads-up
no promises on spelling errors :wink:
lol
I wish all we had to worry about is spelling errors! :slightly_smiling_face:
It’s a spelling-invariant digital signature/commitment scheme !
laughing
I need another maintainer to submit this please (changing the default port number of fabric-ca). Thanks.
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4671>
